required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: D-Lung: An Analytics Platform for Lung Cancer Based on Deep Learning Technology
clinical_study.official_title: D-Lung: An Analytics Platform for Primary Lung Cancer Screening, Diagnosis and Management Based on Deep Learning Technology

collaborator.agency: Department of Computer Science & Engineering, CUHK

brief_summary.textblock: Lung cancer is one of main cause of cancer death in worldwide, characterized of low 5-year survival rate of less than 20%. Pulmonary nodule is considered as the typical imaging manifestation in early stage of lung cancer. The National Lung Screen Trial has demonstrated that the mortality rates could decline greatly, by the utility of low-dose helical computed tomography for screen of pulmonary nodules. Thus, automatic detection, diagnosis and management of pulmonary nodules, play the vital roles in computer-aided lung cancer screening and early intervention.

primary_outcome.description: proportion of true results(both true positives and true negatives) among whole instances
true positive rate in percentage(%) derived by ROC analysis
true negative rate in percentage (%) derived by ROC analysis
area under ROC curve in percentage (%)

secondary_outcome.measure: average number of false positives per scan (FPs/scan)
secondary_outcome.description: FPs/scan in number (N) based on free-response receiver operating characteristic (FROC) analysis

Competitive performance metric (CPM) is a criterion used for CAD system evaluation. Based on FROC paradigm, CPM score is computed as an average sensitivity at seven predefined average false positive rates. CPM score ranges from 0 to 1, with higher CPM score indicating better CAD performance.

intervention.description: thoracic CT examinations for diagnosis, and/or follow-up.

study_pop.textblock: This is a single institutional retrospective cohort study of patients within hospitals in Hong Kong, who had undergone thoracic CT for suspicious lung nodules.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Subjects with suspicious lung nodules.
- Thin-layer thoracic CT and pathology examination have been performed for suspicious lung nodules.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Subjects with accompanied lesions on CT images that may interfere to lung nodules analysis

facility.name: The Chinese University of Hong Kong, Prince of Wale Hospital
